summary: The document is a certification report from the U.S. House of Representatives, specifically from the Select Committee on Assassinations, dated March 7, 1979. It details the payroll expenditures for the accounting period from February 1, 1979, to February 28, 1979, listing employees' names, social security numbers, job titles, annual salaries, period earnings, and remarks regarding their employment status. It also includes a summary of payroll expenditures categorized by employee type and certifies compliance with regulations regarding relationships to current members of Congress.
key_findings: The document provides a detailed payroll record for the Select Committee on Assassinations for February 1979.
It includes information on both terminated and active employees during the accounting period.
The salary limits for the period were set at a minimum of $1,200.00 and a maximum of $47,500.00.
A total of 16 employees were listed under the investigative category, with total expenditures amounting to $34,300.01.
The document certifies the employees' performance of official duties and their compliance with regulations regarding relationships to current members of Congress.
